description.text:
SETUP: Each player gets 1 Allegiance card, 1 [TRAITOR], and 1 [WILD] token.
A Hero may choose to play their Hero card facedown to discard their [TRAITOR].
Once 2 Missions are completed, players guess the Traitor. If correct, gain 1 [WILD] token. Loyal Heroes still with [TRAITOR] take damage until KO'd.
Traitor is removed and now plays the Villain, drawing 2 Master Plan cards and playing 1 each turn.

bio.text: 'Him', the artificial human who was created on Earth and rebelled against his creators. He travelled into space, and under the name 'Warlock', gained new powers, like the ability to manipulate matter. In his travels he met the evil Magus of the religious organization Universal Church of Truth. Warlock, joining forces with Pip the Troll, Gamora, and Thanos, tried to overtake Magus. But when Warlock learned that Magus was a future version of himself who had travelled back in time, he went to the future to steal his own soul in order to prevent Magus from ever existing.

bio.text: Due to her past trauma and loner status, America often challenges authority and keeps others at arms' length. She has a strong independent streak, which makes her less quick to gel into the team dynamic with the others. She openly rejects leadership, preferring to do her own thing and act in her own best interest. America knows how to use her powers very well (maybe too well), which can make her a little critical of the others' flailing efforts. As America begins to trust her team and let them in, we will see her soften and become a better teammate and hero.

bio.text: Former thief Scott Lang once stole an advanced size-altering suit in order to aid his ailing daughter, only to discover that the pilfered tech belonged to the world-renowned Dr. Hank Pym. Seeing the heroic potential within him, Dr. Pym allowed Scott to continue using the suit, as well as the identity Pyn once battled evil under. As the astonishing Ant-Man, Scott now handles the jobs 'too small' for any other Super Hero.

bio.text: One of the last surviving members of the alien Korbinite race, Beta Ray Bill was chosen for his courage to be the protector of his endangered people. Though possessing a fearful countenance, the alien warrior's honor and worthiness were proven to all when a fateful encounter with the mighty Thor left Bill in possession of the mystical hammer Mjolnir. Granted an enchanted hammer of his own by the All-Father Odin, Beta Ray Bill was forever bound to the Asgardian people as a fellow champion and brother-in-arms to the noble Thor.

bio.text: The illicit thrills of lockpicking, safe-cracking and larceny set Hardy - calling herself the Black Cat - on a collision course with New York's friendly neighborhood Super Hero, Spider-Man. Black Cat was immediately smitten with the arachnid adventurer and started a relationship with him. But it soon became apparent that Hardy had no interest in the man behind Spider- Man's mask-it was the web-slinger and his danger-filled lifestyle she was attracted to. Since parting romantic ways with the wall-crawler, Hardy has registered herself as a bona fide Super Hero and joined the Heroes for Hire team.

bio.text: Monarch of the secluded but technologically advanced African nation of Wakanda. King T'Challa is the Black Panther, a sacred title that must be both inherited & earned by the current Wakandan ruler. Granted superhuman powers by ceremonially consuming a mystical heart-shaped herb, the Panther is responsible for defending his people, and the world, from any threats.

bio.text: Raised from an early age in the top-secret Red Room program. Natasha Romanoff was trained to be the Black Widow, a dangerous super-spy & master in the arts of espionage, subversion and combat. She ultimately defected from her original keepers instead seeking to right the wrongs of her past by joining the covert intelligence Agency S.H.I.E.L.D. Now, as a   member of the heroic Avengers, Black Widow uses her unequalled skills to protect the innocent.

bio.text: The man known as Blade was born into a world of blood and darkness over seven decades ago. His mother - tainted by a vampire's fatal kiss at the moment of his birth - passed along a birthright of unholy enzymes that transformed the boy born Eric Brooks into 'The Daywalker'. As a half-vampire and vigilant hunter at the undead, Blade's long, tragic history has shown him that mankind is at war for its very soul, and that his unique circumstances have equipped him to stand on the front line. Within, Blade fights a different battle against his own fierce nature, ever struggling against the desire to submit to his own vampiric heritage.

bio.text: During WWII, the frail but courageous Steve Rogers was injected with an experimental Super-Soldier serum, emerging from the treatment as the pinnacle of human physical potential. Outfitted with a patriotic costume and iconic S.H.I.E.L.D., he became the legendary Captain America! Though frozen in ice for decades after a climactic battle, Cap re-emerged in modern times, continuing the battle against evil as leader of the Avengers.

bio.text: A chance encounter with an alien being granted ace U.S. Air Force pilot Carol Danvers incredible powers. Endeavoring to use her fantastic new abilities for the forces of good, Danvers joined the Super Hero community in their ongoing struggle against evil. After years served protecting the planet, she began a new chapter in her heroic story when she took the legendary mantle of Captain Marvel, earth's mightiest hero!

bio.text: Matt was raised by his father in Hell's Kitchen. His father's aspirations for his son to escape the cycle of poverty and crime were cut short when young Matt valiantly pushed a stranger out off the path of a chemical truck. Immersed in the toxic cargo of the truck, Matt lost his power of sight, but his remaining senses were enhanced to incredible levels. Under the tutelage of the martial arts master Stick, Matt became a formidable fighter. His father was murdered by agents of the Fixer for refusing to throw a fight. Enraged when the legal system failed to bring the Fixer to justice, Matt donned a costume made from his father's boxing robe and went into action as Daredevil.

bio.text: Distinguished neurosurgeon Doctor Stephen Strange's self-important worldview was shattered, along with his steady operating hands, in a Fateful car accident. Desperate to heal his injuries and pride, Strange sought a legendary sage known as the Ancient One, becoming a pupil of the mystic arts. Learning that his true worth had always come From within, Strange uncovered his Full potential and was chosen to become the Sorcerer Supreme, the world's pre-eminent defender against the darkness that lurks beyond.

bio.text: Fueled by a personal vendetta against those who cost him his family, the rough-edged warrior called Drax the Destroyer has room in his life for little else besides revenge. To this end, the heavily tattooed Drax has long relied upon his proficiency in battle and his razor-sharp blades to do his talking for him. After making a tentative alliance with the Guardians of the Galaxy, the untamed Drax must learn to put the needs of the universe before his own.

bio.text: After losing her father during a botched hostage situation, Elektra began a regimen of martial arts training, eventually joining the league of mercenaries The Hand. When demand for her practiced abilities brought her back to America, she was surprised to find her college boyfriend had become Daredevil! For a time, the two estranged lovers could not escape from their violent clash of law and disorder and only found peace when the psychopathic Bullseye took Elektra's life. Since her resurrection by The Hand, the renewed Elektra strives towards righteousness and purity.

bio.text: Born and raised in Harlem, New York, Sam Wilson was an intelligent and adventurous child who possessed a great affinity for birds. Later, after excelling at the top of his class at S.H.I.E.L.D., a chance encounter with the legendary Captain America brought out his inner hero. When the call came for him to join the Avengers, Sam didn't hesitate - he donned a high-tech winged harness and took to the skies as the high-flying Falcon.

Later, after excelling at the top of his class at S.H.I.E.L.D., a chance encounter with the legendary Captain America brought out his inner hero. When the call came for him to join the Avengers, Sam didn't hesitate - he donned a high-tech winged harness and took to the skies as the high-flying Falcon.

bio.text: Orphaned as a child when the rest of her species was annihilated, Gamora was found and raised by the tyrant Thanos, who conditioned her to become an unparalleled warrior. Weary of the acts she was forced to commit in her would-be father's name, Gamora later broke free of her chains. Teaming up with Star-Lord and his motley crew, the 'most dangerous woman in the galaxy' now seeks to redeem her past crimes, putting her unparalleled skills to use as a member of the Guardians of the Galaxy.

bio.text: Robbie Reyes is a high-school student working as a mechanic at an auto body shop. During a street race he's killed by mercenaries and is revived as a demonic being possessed by the spirit of Eli Morrow, a deceased serial-killing Satanist. As Ghost Rider, Reyes possesses superhuman strength, speed, agility and the capability of conjuring 'natural and hellish ﬂames'. He drives a car that allows him, when in Ghost Rider form, to instantly teleport to and / or merge with the car.

bio.text: ln an alternate universe, a twist of fate caused Midtown High student Gwen Stacy to receive the bite of a radioactive spider instead of Peter Parker, granting her amazing arachnid-like abilities. Taking on the name Ghost-Spider, Stacy donned a unique costume and endeavored to exploit her newfound talents for personal gain and attention. However, when Parker died in a tragic lab experiment gone wrong, Stacy learned that with great power there must also come great responsibility. Now she uses her powers to protect the innocent. balancing her life as Ghost-Spider with the challenges of teenage life.

bio.text: The last surviving member at a treelike alien race, Groot is perhaps one of the most unusual beings in all the cosmos. Though calm and quiet in most instances, he is known to unleash his tremendous strength on any enemy foolish enough to threaten his allies, particularly his longtime partner in crime, Rocket. Though he can only vocalize using the phrase, 'l am Groot', the gentle giant's friends are nevertheless able to understand his exact meaning through his subtle inflections.

bio.text: Howard the Duck is from Duckworld, a planet in an alternate dimension, where intelligent life evolved from waterfowl. Although he has no superhuman abilities, he is skilled in Quack-Fu, a martial art. This is enough for him to fight and defeat his opponents. Originally dropped in the middle of the Florida Everglades, Howard would eventually fall off the 'Stepping Stones of oblivion' and wind up stranded in Cleveland, Ohio where he ran into adversaries like the Band of the Bland and Doctor Bong.

bio.text: During a violent kidnapping at the hands of terrorists intent on forcing him to build a bomb, billionaire industrialist Tony Stark suffered a near-fatal chest wound. Instead of the weapon his captors had in mind, Stark constructed a sophisticated metal suit that both stabilized his injury and allowed him to escape. Upon returning home, he vowed to use his resources and intellect to protect the world as the armored hero Iron Man!

bio.text: Jessica Jones was a lonely high school student who manifested superhuman abilities after her family's car crashed with a truck transporting unidentified experimental material. Inspired by her new abilities, Jones briefly became the Super Hero Jewel! But after suffering unimaginable mental and physical torture at the hands of the villainous Purple Man, she decided that she was not suited for her work. Jessica gave up her alter ego and started a new career as a private investigator, specializing in cases dealing with superhuman activity.

bio.text: He's a member of the alien species Kronan and possesses superhuman strength, able, like most of his species, to lift at least 100 tons. After being attacked by a group of Spikes (parasitic life forms), Korg discovered he was immune to their destruction. What's more, he's also a skilled fighter, military strategist and weapons builder. As a one-time prisoner of the Red King on Sakaar, Korg became an ally of the Hulk, eventually fighting alongside him in a rebellion against the King. Korg would go on to liberate the people of Sakaar.

bio.text: Born and raised in Harlem, Carl Lucas spent his youth committing petty thefts on behalf of deformed crime-lord Sonny Caputo, a.k.a. Hammer. While in prison, he volunteers for experimental cell regeneration based on a variant of the Super-Soldier process, inducing body-wide enhancement that gives him superhuman strength and durability. He uses his new power to escape prison, making his way to New York, where a chance encounter with criminals inspires him to use his new powers for profit as Luke Cage, Hero for Hire!

bio.text: An unexpected betrayal during an archeological dig in Egypt left professional mercenary Marc Spector mortally wounded before an ancient statue of the moon god Khonshu. As his heart stopped beating, Spector experienced a vision: Khonshu reached out to Spector's soul, offering him a second chance at life in exchange for serving as the deity's earthly avatar. Awakening, Specteor returned to America and began life anew, setting up several aliases and developing his previously accumulated wealth into a small fortune capable of aiding his career as the silver-cloaked crime-fighter Moon Knight.

bio.text: Kamala is a fan of most Super Heroes.. especially her mentor, Captain Marvel. She has near encyclopedic knowledge of the Avengers and is not afraid to show it. She's got a big heart and isn't as quick to judge others as some of her teammates. Kamala is getting pretty good at using her new powers and is determined to prove that she can be a great hero alongside her new teammates. Her positive attitude and loyalty to Carol sometimes causes conﬂict with others, but she strives to create team unity, and her enthusiasm is infectious.

bio.text: A merciless space pirate, Nebula was taught by her adopted father, the cosmic tyrant Thanos, to achieve victory by any means. Unlike her redeemed foster sister Gamora, Nebula seeks only power, allying herself with anyone capable of aiding in her schemes. A cunning fighter, Nebula has frequently positioned herself as a thorn in the side of her most recurring nemeses, the eclectic Guardians of the Galaxy, though she would end up reluctantly allying with them.

bio.text: Nick Fury has proudly served the Free world in many capacities over the long years - as a U.S. Army sergeant, as a tech-savvy super-spy, and as Director of the world's pre-eminent peacekeeping and intelligence organization, S.H.I.E.L.D. Though always reliable, Fury typically works in secret, orchestrating events and communicating with those he can trust from the shadows. Fury comes out fighting when the forces of good are backed against the wall, often resurfacing with vital information and much needed backup when things seem dire.

bio.text: Sam Alexander is a Nova Centurion and member of the intergalactic police force called Nova Corps. His powers come from a helmet that grants him access to the Nova Force. Originally worn by his now-missing father Jesse, Sam was trained to use the helmet by Gamora and Rocket Raccoon. Through the Nova Force he’s given superhuman strength, durability, flight, energy projection, telekinesis, universal translation, the ability to breathe underwater and the ability to survive in space.

bio.text: Pietro and his twin sister, Wanda (who would become Scarlet Witch), were born on Mt. Wundagore. It's here, they realized they had innate superhuman powers, with Pietro discovering his ability to move at superhuman speed. A series of misfortunes would have the twins growing up on their own, but always together. Eventually their lives would lead them to join the Avengers where Pietro, as Quicksilver, would put to use his abilities to run beyond the speed of sound, run up walls, create cyclones out of sheer speed and more.

bio.text: Though he may look like a common Earth raccoon, the temperamental Rocket is in fact a one-of-a-kind genetically produced being, originally created in the planet Halfworld. This diminutive, tough-talking creature is a master pilot, engineer, marksman and weapons specialist. Previously a small-time thief along with his partner Groot, Rocket lends his genius and heavy artillery to the Guardians of the Galaxy, unable to resist the call of adventure (and plunder)!

bio.text: Wanda and her twin brother Pietro were born on Mt. Wundagore. It's here, absorbing the mountain's mystical energy, Wanda was given the ability to use magic in addition to her other superpowers. A series of misfortunes would have the twins growing up on their own, but always together. Eventually their lives would lead them to join the Avengers. As Scarlet Witch, Wanda can manipulate matter and fly. She's able to manipulate Chaos Magic - ridding herself and the world of anyone she doesn't like with just a thought. As an Avenger she casts spells to aid the oppressed.

bio.text: Born to a wealthy international crime lord, Shang Chi was raised in isolation, never suspecting that his father was training him to become the ultimate living weapon. Upon learning the awful truth of his father's evil nature, he renounced his family and employed his exceptional martial arts skills as a secret agent for the British Special Forces group MI-6. Since then, Shang Chi has dedicated his life to overthrowing his father's evil empire and protecting the innocent as the Master of Kung Fu!

bio.text: Jennifer Walters, the small and somewhat shy cousin of Bruce Banner [Hulk], is shot and seriously wounded in a day that Bruce Banner happened to be in town for a visit. bio.text: Princess of Wakanda and younger sister to King T'Challa, Shuri grew up in the shadow of her prodigious older brother. Eager to prove her worth, she underwent a grueling set of trials in order to become the Black Panther, only to discover that T’Challa had already won the title. However. understanding his sister's heart and skill, T'Challa passed on the rule of Wakanda when circumstances demanded his absence. As the new Black Panther, Shuri now protects her people and homeland with unrivaled commitment and ferocity.

bio.text: lt's Spider-Man... as a cartoon pig! Spider-Ham, aka 'Peter' Porker, is a sweet well-intentioned member of the Spider Family. bio.text: In an alternate future in which the corrupt Alchemax corporation took over New York City, the brilliant geneticist Miguel O’Hara, inspired by the surviving records of the legendary Spider-Man, sought to create a similarly powered individual. Though his work was initially imperfect, an attempt at sabotaging O’Hara's experiments left him on the receiving end of fantastic spider powers. With a futuristic costume equipped with high-tech gear, O’Hara set out to undo the damage done to  the world by Alchemax, becoming a new Spider-Man for the year 2099.

bio.text: Suffering radiation poisoning at a young age, Jessica Drew was injected with a mysterious Spider Serum and sealed in a genetic accelerator for years. Jessica emerged fully grown, with no memory and unthinkable powers, a bioelectric 'venom sting' and the ability to emit manipulative pheromones. Throughout her erratic career she has used her Spider-Woman abilities to pursue her own agenda, working for the villainous group Hydra, spying for the global security division called S.H.I.E.L.D. and most recently fighting for good alongside the heroic Avengers!

bio.text: Doreen's fun-loving, goofy persona comes naturally to her, but is also a great way to keep fear and anxiety at bay when the fate of the world hangs in the balance. Because Doreen comes across as silly, many of her teammates enjoy her company but don't take her too seriously, except for Kamala, her new best friend. Doreen yearns for all of them to respect her more, but she won't  give up the positivity and innocence at her core. She especially gushes over the big-time heroes she aspires to be like. However, she is herself a successful hero because she is a true original.

bio.text: A headstrong intergalactic adventurer, Peter Quill was taken from his Earthly home at a young age, growing up in outer space alongside the pirate-like Ravagers. As the intrepid Star-Lord, Quill travels the cosmos in his spaceship, the Milano, seeking his fortune. Equipped with a high-tech blaster and a mix-tape of music from his home, Star-Lord leads an unlikely team of interstellar misfits - the Guardians of the Galaxy - in their attempts to do a little good, a little bad, a little of both!!

bio.text: An amorphous costume-like entity, the symbiotic being known as Venom has bonded itself to a number of humans over time, many of whom have been completely overwhelmed by the symbiote’s destructive persona. One former host who was able to free himself from Venom’s control was the Amazing Spider-Man - a fact that the angry parasite has never forgotten. Capable of mimicking Spidey's unique powers and endowing new hosts with its own massive strength, the Venom symbiote's ceaseless rage is a danger to all.

bio.text: Bucky Barnes served with honor in WWII alongside his partner and best friend, Captain America. Presumed M.l.A. after a fateful mission toward the end of the war, Bucky had in fact been recovered by enemy agents, who subjected him to a series of traumatic mental and physical experiments. Stripped of his identity, Bucky was reborn as the Winter Soldier. A cunning and dangerous covert operative who could be 'activated' from cryostasis every decade or so to undertake special missions. Ultimately Freed of his brainwashing, Bucky now uses his impressive talents to try to atone for the deeds done while under enemy control.

bio.text: Yondu Udonta acts as leader of the Ravagers, a ruthless army of unscrupulous space pirates and mercenaries.Long ago he was hired to capture the young Earthling Peter Quill, a.k.a. Star-Lord, through a last-minute change of heart, caused Yondu to betray his employer and bring Quill into the fold as one of his own, serving almost as a surrogate father. Though he occasionally shows faint glimmers of compassion, Yondu's greed more often causes him to betray even his closest allies any time the promise of some quick credits is involved.

bio.text: Heinrich Zemno, 12th in line to claim the title Baron Zemo, used his warped scientific genius to advance the forces of fascism during WWII. Consumed by a violent hatred for Captain America, Zemo went to great lengths to vanquish his foe, making great advances in the field of laser technology, adhesives and genetic manipulation. After his cruel practices began attracting too much attention, Baron Zemo tried to regain a level of anonymity by wearing a hood over his face, but was driven insane instead, when the hood permanently adhered to his skin during a botched battle. Zemo's son, Helmut, has claimed the title in the modern era, along with his father's hatred for Captain America.

bio.text: Despite his name, Black Dwarf is a massive alien and brutal follower of Thanos and his  Black Order, and he'll do whatever it takes to accomplish his master's evil goals. Helping him to that end, Black Dwarf possesses impenetrable skin, and superhuman strength, durability and stamina, making him a feared battle opponent. To match his awesome size, Black Dwarf wields massive bladed and blunt force weapons.

bio.text: Though his real name has never come to light, law officers, heroes, and even other professional assassins are frighteningly familiar with Bullseye's reputation. A sadist of the highest order, the unstable mercenary defines himself through his eerily acute marksmanship, classifying anyone who gets in his way as a target. After years in the employ of the Kingpin of crime, an intense personal obsession with the hero Daredevil eventually led Bullseye to a severe injury. Physically rehabilitated, the psychotic outlaw has reluctantly agreed to work off his crimes in the service of national security.

bio.text: Created from the alien being known as Venom, the Carnage symbiote is an amorphous lite form that can bond with a host, granting it superhuman powers. In a twist of fate that would spell disaster for innocents around the world, the Carnage symbiote encountered and bonded with Cletus Kasady, an unstable and dangerous criminal. With the symbiote's strength and Kasady's ferocity, Carnage became a threat unlike any other, kept in check only by heroes like the Amazing Spider-Man.

bio.text: Corvus Glaive is Thanos' right-hand man and a leader at the elite alien group, the Black Order. Most of his power comes from his extremely potent cosmic glaive (the blade's edge is so sharp it can separate atoms). The glaive gives him near immortality - as long as it's not destroyed, Corvus can survive any lethal attack. His powers  also include super strength, endurance and speed. Glaive was at one time part of Namor's Cabal, where he used the opportunity to wreak havoc upon other worlds before taking part in their destruction.

bio.text: Once a highly respected physicist and inventor. Dr. Otto Octavius's life took a tragic turn when a lab accident fused his greatest creation, a harness equipped with four mechanical tentacle-like arms, to his body. The same incident left him mentally unstable, amplifying his already existing arrogance to megalomaniacal levels. Seeking to prove himself the greatest criminal mind ever to walk the planet. Octavius embraced the nickname that he had once been given, setting forth to dominate the city as the infamous Doctor Octopus.

bio.text: Along with his sister, Dormammu is a being of energy known as a Faltine. As children, they were driven from their home dimension, and, after taking on the form of material human beings, the siblings settled in the Dark Dimension. There, Dormammu befriended the king before ultimately overthrowing him. During his rule, Dormammu again became pure energy. His quest for power led him to Earth, but here he was ultimately stopped by the first Sorcerer Supreme, Agamotto. Dormammu is an immensely powerful mystical being, capable of abilities that include telepathy, soul manipulation, elemental control, teleportation, and more.

bio.text: As a prominent member of the Black Order, Ebony Maw can be found in the devoted service of Thanos, his adoptive father. Rather than physical strength. Maw is gifted with a genius-level intellect and the abilities of telepathy, telekinesis, mind control and flight. He often uses his intellect and persuasive voice to masterfully manipulate and control even the strongest minds, leading to being described as 'a black tongue that spreads mischief and evil wherever he goes'. But his allegiances prove fickle, as he turns on Thanos in favor of Thanos' offspring, Thane .. ultimately turning him too.

bio.text: While working on an overhead power line, disgruntled linesman Max Dillon was struck by lightning from a rolling thunderstorm. The resulting electrical shock imbued Dillon with the power to store and discharge vast amounts of electricity. Trading his blue-collar existence for a colorful costume, Dillon has jolted the world of crime for years as the high-voltage villain Electro!
bio.locText: While working on an overhead power line, disgruntled linesman Max Dillon was struck by lightning from a rolling thunderstorm. The resulting electrical shock imbued Dillon with the power to store and discharge vast amounts of electricity. Trading his blue-collar existence for a colorful costume, Dillon has jolted the world of crime for years as the high-voltage villain Electro!

bio.text: A powerful businessman and industrialist, Norman Osborn gained superhuman abilities during a lab accident in which he was testing an experimental serum. Left mentally deranged as a side effect at the transformation, Osborn set about to wreak havoc on the streets of New York as the costumed criminal known as the Green Goblin. Despite his recurring maniacal efforts to sow chaos throughout the city, the Goblin is kept at bay by the heroic efforts of his long time arch-nemesis, the Amazing Spider-Man.

bio.text: She's the daughter of Loki and Angerboda, and was appointed Asgardian Goddess of Death by Odin. As such she rules two of the nine realms: Hel (land of the dead) and Niffleheim (land of eternal ice). Hela has such a thirst for power, she once longed to possess the souls of Odin and his son, Thor. Hela can both take the life of gods and restore their life. She can teleport across all realms, open time portals and levitate. However, her powers are severely weakened without her cloak.

bio.text: Born in the far-off year 3000, Nathanial Richards' thirst for power and significance compelled him to conquer the dimension of time. As the armored anachronaut Kang, he visited his will upon countless eras throughout history. Known alternately as Immortus, Pharaoh Rama-Tut and the Scarlet Centurion - Kang's multiple lives through the ages have become progressively non-linear and each temporal foray creates more divergent counterparts with their own loathsome agendas. In some ways Kang's quest for historical domination has been too successful, as he perpetually comes into conflict with alternate versions of himself!

bio.text: Killmonger is the nemesis of Black Panther and a fierce warrior. A native of Wakanda, he survived his father's death and his family's exile. Thus began Killmonger's lifelong mission to avenge his father's death by reclaiming Wakanda and returning it to its ancient ways. He would use Black Panther's frequent absences to try to overthrow their government. Killmonger's skills are concentrated in hand-to-hand combat as well as his ever-evolving uniform, which usually has deadly elements like energy blasters. He has extensive martial arts knowledge and a willingness to do whatever it takes to achieve his goals.

bio.text: Whether a petty misdemeanor or grand larceny, every crime follows an untraceable route back to Kingpin, a mob boss of nearly mythic proportions. After years as the legendary czar of organized corruption, Wilson Fisk has buried his once noble heart beneath an unforgiving exterior. No longer the robust Bronx thug he was years ago, Fisk expertly uses front organizations, dummy foundations and his intimidating reputation to cover up the illicit activities of his subordinates. As a result, those on both sides of the law fear and respect the Kingpin's unlawful reign!

bio.text: Former Russian noble Sergei Kravinoff came to America for one reason: to hunt Spider-Man, the ultimate prey. Kraven’s fighting skills combined with mystical strength-enhancing potions from the darkest jungles of Africa made him a prolific gamesman, a legacy that has outlived him. Kraven the Hunter’s initial pursuit of the wall-crawler gave way to a years-long feud, and Kraven's repeated failures slowly drove him to the brink of insanity, and eventually resulted in his death.

bio.text: Raised in Asgard alongside the mighty Thor, Loki’s feelings of jealousy toward his noble foster brother ultimately turned his innate mischievousness to true evil. Ever seeking to challenge his brother’s virtuous deeds. Loki uses his talents for manipulation and trickery in an obsessive quest to rule both Asgard and earth. Caring for nothing but the rewards of his own schemes, Loki will lie, cheat, and take any immoral action necessary to prove himself superior to his Asgardian brethren.

bio.text: Acronyms and acrimony abounded when the anarchist analysts at A.l.M. [Advanced Idea Mechanics] transformed lowly technician George Tartleton into a 'Mobile Organism Designed Only for Computing'. Abused, but brilliant beyond the scope of normal human intellect, Tartleton grew indignant in his role as a sentient data processor. Using newfound psychic endowments, the misshapen misanthrope soon overthrew his creators and rechristened himself a 'Mobile Organism Designed Only for Killing' - M.O.D.O.K.! Now Scientist Supreme at A.l.M., M.O.D.O.K. explores any vastly powerful individual or technology that might help bend the world to his grotesque mental power!

bio.text: Hollywood stuntman and special effects wizard Quentin Beck found his current career as a dead-end job. With dreams of grandeur, he decided to put his expertise in illusions to use as the super-villain Mysterio! In his holographic inducing costume, he has utilized many clever traps that have constantly been exposed by the Amazing Spider-Man!

bio.text: A member of a world Thanos destroyed, Proxima Midnight was taken by Thanos and raised as his own daughter. Considered one of the fiercest warriors in the universe, Proxima Midnight travels the world with her deadly spear - forged by Thanos himself and marked by its tip of a star trapped in a quantum singularity - making her one of Thanos' most feared allies. But her strengths aren't limited to her spear, which never misses and kills anyone it pierces. She also possesses superhuman strength, speed and endurance.

bio.text: The same Super-Soldier Serum that transformed Steve Rogers into Captain America during WWII endowed HYDRA mastermind Johann Schmidt with greatly enhanced strength and stamina. However an imperfection in the process caused Schmidt's Face to become hideously disfigured, morphing into a chilling skull-like visage. Feared from that day forward as the Red Skull. Schmidt and his HYDRA army clashed with Cap many times over the course of the war. Though both men were presumed lost in the conﬂict, they were revived in modern times, continuing the ongoing struggle between good and evil.

bio.text: Though well-intentioned, minimally educated Russian immigrant Aleksei Sytsevich used his great size and strength as a hired thug for the mafia in hopes to financially support his poor family. When offered money to undergo a secret superhuman experiment, the desperate Sytsevich accepted. Imparted with massively heightened strength and speed as well as a durable polymer permanently banned to his skin, the newly named Rhino embarked on a criminal career selling his muscle to the highest bidders.

bio.text: Raised on the Kree homeworld, Hala, Ronan's fierce devotion and aptitude allowed him to rise in the exalted position of Supreme Accuser of the Kree Empire. However, his overly zealous lust for justice and draconian adherence to ancient traditions caused Ronan to be seen as a fanatic in the eyes of his people, leading him and the more progressive Kree to a divisive split. Setting out with an army of devoted followers, Ronan now seeks to pass judgment on all those he sees as heathens, and scour the galaxy of their presence.

bio.text: From an early age, Willam Baker chose to live a life of crime, often finding himself behind bars. Baker escaped one of his incarcerations only to find himself on a beach near an atomic testing site. After being bombarded with a massive dose of radiation, Baker awoke with the ability to transform himself into sand-like forms that he could manipulate and reshape at will. Eager to put his new abilities to use, he attempted a series of audacious robberies as the Sandman!

bio.text: Taskmaster has the ability to mimic the physical movements and vocal sounds of anyone he witnesses just once. Doctors labeled this 'photographic reflexes'. It's this ability that gives Taskmaster superhuman speed, but for only minutes at a time, and a mastery of martial arts, mimicking the personal fighting styles of numerous individuals he's studied. These skills were later enhanced when Taskmaster injected himself with Super Soldier Serum (ultimately it would cause Taskmaster to lose memories). His skills have been put to use on both sides of the law, as he's been a trainer for both criminal networks and the government.

bio.text: Perhaps the most feared being in the cosmos, the mad titan Thanos is a nihilist of the highest order. His sole ambition is to return the universe to what he believes is its natural state - oblivion. Growing in power and infamy as he traverses the stars, Thanos regularly causes wanton destruction and leaves a devastating swath of chaos in his wake, often seeking out terrifying sources of cosmic power, like the legendary Infinity Stones, in an effort to see all of existence tremble in his shadow.

bio.text: Originally programmed to aid mankind, the artificial intelligence known as Ultron instead decided upon activation that the best way to help the human race would be to cause their extinction. Setting about to enact his terrible plans, the unstable villain has proven himself an extremely dangerous foe, capable of infiltrating virtually any computer network and inhabiting a seemingly endless series of powerful mechanical buddies. Even in defeat the menace of Ultron always looms, as even a trace of his code can potentially lead to a full restoration of his consciousness.

bio.text: An amorphous costume-like entity, the symbiotic being known as Venom has bonded itself to a number of humans over time, many of whom have been completely overwhelmed by the symbiote’s destructive persona. One former host who was able to free himself from Venom’s control was the Amazing Spider-Man - a fact that the angry parasite has never forgotten. Capable of mimicking Spidey's unique powers and endowing new hosts with its own massive strength, the Venom symbiote's ceaseless rage is a danger to all.

bio.text: Racked by physical infirmities and a driving desire to reclaim his youth, the elderly electronics engineer Adrian Toomes fashioned a magnetic wing harness that augments his strength and allows him to take in the air at dizzying speeds. Throughout his high-flying criminal career, Toomes has proven a calculating, remorseless killer who is always willing to team up with fellow villains if he thinks it will finally provide the means to defeat his arch-foe Spider-Man.

bio.text:
Perhaps it required someone with an intellect as towering as Doctor Otto Octavius to conclude that heroes are much stronger and more effective working as a group, and villains should therefore adopt the same tactics. Naturally, villains are mistrustful of each other, and therein lies the problem. But with someone like Doc Ock in charge, and by executing successful plan after plan, even the most misanthropic villain can see the advantages of teamwork.
Enter: The Sinister Six! Doctor Octopus has called together the most dangerous villains of New York City, united by their hatred of Spider-Man. Between Electro's raw power, Sandman's incredible strength, Vulture's tech savvy, Kraven's savage cunning, and Mysterio's mind-bending illusions, Doctor Octopus has the makings of an Avengers-level threat! With the Six working together, even Earth's mightiest heroes will fall before their collective villainy!
Bringing the Six to justice will require coordination, planning, quick thinking, and teamwork the likes of which the evil Six can only dream of. Let us show the Sinister Six that even villains working in concert are no match for heroes that stand united!

question.locText: If I must add multiple Civilian and/or Thug tokens to a Location, but there are no slots available, how many times is the Overflow effect triggered?

answer.text: Only once. However, some Overflow effects (like Ultron and Red Skull) specify a consequence for each token that you can’t add to the Location.

question.text: Can Heroes’ Actions and Special Effects be performed in any order?
question.locText: Can Heroes’ Actions and Special Effects be performed in any order?

answer.text: Yes. You could do an action on your card, then your special effect, then an action on the previous card.
answer.locText: Yes. You could do an action on your card, then your special effect, then an action on the previous card.

question.text: If I don’t use an action, do I gain an Action token?
question.locText: If I don’t use an action, do I gain an Action token?

answer.text: No. Action tokens are gained through specific Hero and Location effects. A Hero can always choose not to use an action, but they gain nothing for it.
answer.locText: No. Action tokens are gained through specific Hero and Location effects. A Hero can always choose not to use an action, but they gain nothing for it.

question.text: If a Threat indicates a Thug requires 2 damage to be defeated, can I deal 1 damage now and 1 damage in a future turn?
question.locText: If a Threat indicates a Thug requires 2 damage to be defeated, can I deal 1 damage now and 1 damage in a future turn?

answer.text: No. Thugs don’t have Health, they are either defeated or not, so all damage needs to be dealt to them on the same turn.
answer.locText: No. Thugs don’t have Health, they are either defeated or not, so all damage needs to be dealt to them on the same turn.

question.text: If I complete the 2nd Mission and still have actions left, can I attack the Villain on the same turn?
question.locText: If I complete the 2nd Mission and still have actions left, can I attack the Villain on the same turn?

answer.text: Yes (as long as you are in their Location and have attacks left to use).
answer.locText: Yes (as long as you are in their Location and have attacks left to use).

question.text: If multiple Heroes are KO’d at the same time, is the Villain’s [BAM!] effect triggered more than once?
question.locText: If multiple Heroes are KO’d at the same time, is the Villain’s [BAM!] effect triggered more than once?

answer.text: Yes, the Villain resolves one [BAM!] for each KO’d Hero.
answer.locText: Yes, the Villain resolves one [BAM!] for each KO’d Hero.

question.text: If a Hero is KO’d, are Henchmen’s [BAM!] effects triggered?
question.locText: If a Hero is KO’d, are Henchmen’s [BAM!] effects triggered?

answer.text: No, only the Villain’s [BAM!] effect is resolved.
answer.locText: No, only the Villain’s [BAM!] effect is resolved.

question.text: While a Hero is KO’d, can they be given Action tokens, or moved by special effects?
question.locText: While a Hero is KO’d, can they be given Action tokens, or moved by special effects?

answer.text: No. A KO’d Hero is ignored by all effects, whether positive or negative.
answer.locText: No. A KO’d Hero is ignored by all effects, whether positive or negative.

question.text: If a Hero has more than 1 copy of the card with a single Wild symbol (like Captain Marvel), how many of them are removed when using the Moderate or Heroic Challenge?
question.locText: If a Hero has more than 1 copy of the card with a single Wild symbol (like Captain Marvel), how many of them are removed when using the Moderate or Heroic Challenge?

answer.text: You only remove 1 copy of those cards during setup.
answer.locText: You only remove 1 copy of those cards during setup.

question.text: If a Hero has an Invulnerable token, are they still eligible to volunteer or be chosen to take damage in order to satisfy a special effect?
question.locText: If a Hero has an Invulnerable token, are they still eligible to volunteer or be chosen to take damage in order to satisfy a special effect?

answer.text: Yes, they are, and since they can’t take any damage until the start of their next turn, they take no damage.
answer.locText: Yes, they are, and since they can’t take any damage until the start of their next turn, they take no damage.

question.text: If I have an Invulnerable token and then start my turn on a Location with a Threat that deals damage at the start of my turn, do I take damage?
question.locText: If I have an Invulnerable token and then start my turn on a Location with a Threat that deals damage at the start of my turn, do I take damage?

answer.text: Yes. The Invulnerable token is only in effect until the start of your turn. Once your turn starts, you are vulnerable again and take the Threat’s damage.
answer.locText: Yes. The Invulnerable token is only in effect until the start of your turn. Once your turn starts, you are vulnerable again and take the Threat’s damage.

question.text: What happens if I have 1 card in hand and start my turn on a Location with a Threat that deals damage at the start of my turn?
question.locText: What happens if I have 1 card in hand and start my turn on a Location with a Threat that deals damage at the start of my turn?

answer.text: The Threat deals damage as soon as your turn starts, so you don’t have a chance to draw 1 card before being KO’d. Since you were KO’d at the start of your turn, you basically lose that turn. On your next turn, the Threat’s damage doesn’t affect you since you have no cards yet. You’re then placed back up, draw 4 cards, and continue playing.
answer.locText: The Threat deals damage as soon as your turn starts, so you don’t have a chance to draw 1 card before being KO’d. Since you were KO’d at the start of your turn, you basically lose that turn. On your next turn, the Threat’s damage doesn’t affect you since you have no cards yet. You’re then placed back up, draw 4 cards, and continue playing.

question.text: If I clear a Threat with no Threat token next to it, do I not advance the Clear Threats Mission?
question.locText: If I clear a Threat with no Threat token next to it, do I not advance the Clear Threats Mission?

answer.text: If a Threat card has no Threat token next to it (usually because it was brought back into play), when cleared, simply take any available Threat token to place on the Mission card. Also, if a Threat card is ever moved to a different Location, its Threat token should move with it.
answer.locText: If a Threat card has no Threat token next to it (usually because it was brought back into play), when cleared, simply take any available Threat token to place on the Mission card. Also, if a Threat card is ever moved to a different Location, its Threat token should move with it.

question.text: Do Threats with a [LOCATION] symbol only trigger if a Master Plan card shows that symbol?
question.locText: Do Threats with a [LOCATION] symbol only trigger if a Master Plan card shows that symbol?

answer.text: No. The [LOCATION] symbol simply means “Villain ends their move here”. - On Master Plan cards this is used to indicate that the central Location is the one occupied by the Villain when determining where to add Thugs and Civilians. - On Threat cards this indicates the effect is triggered whenever the Villain ends their move there.
answer.locText: No. The [LOCATION] symbol simply means “Villain ends their move here”. - On Master Plan cards this is used to indicate that the central Location is the one occupied by the Villain when determining where to add Thugs and Civilians. - On Threat cards this indicates the effect is triggered whenever the Villain ends their move there.

question.text: S.H.I.E.L.D. HEADQUARTERS - Does this allow me to remove a Crisis token from a Hero?
question.locText: S.H.I.E.L.D. HEADQUARTERS - Does this allow me to remove a Crisis token from a Hero?

answer.text: Yes, you can remove a Crisis token from anywhere.
answer.locText: Yes, you can remove a Crisis token from anywhere.

question.text: STARK LABORATORIES - Does this allow me to swap a card that’s facedown in the Storyline?
question.locText: STARK LABORATORIES - Does this allow me to swap a card that’s facedown in the Storyline?

answer.text: No, you may only manipulate cards that are faceup.
answer.locText: No, you may only manipulate cards that are faceup.

question.text: The Villain’s starting Health is set at what level?
question.locText: The Villain’s starting Health is set at what level?

answer.text: It’s set at the 3-Heroes level.
answer.locText: It’s set at the 3-Heroes level.

question.text: If a Hero gains an Action token, can it only be used by that Hero?
question.locText: If a Hero gains an Action token, can it only be used by that Hero?

answer.text: No, the pool of Action tokens belongs to the player and can be used by any of their Heroes.
answer.locText: No, the pool of Action tokens belongs to the player and can be used by any of their Heroes.

question.text: If a [BAM!] effect deals 1 damage to each Hero in a Location, and all 3 Heroes are in that Location, how much damage do I take?
question.locText: If a [BAM!] effect deals 1 damage to each Hero in a Location, and all 3 Heroes are in that Location, how much damage do I take?

answer.text: You take 3 damage, discarding 3 cards belonging to any Hero to the bottom of your deck.
answer.locText: You take 3 damage, discarding 3 cards belonging to any Hero to the bottom of your deck.

question.text: Do effects that allow me to draw back up to 3 cards (like Avenger’s Mansion and Iron Man’s Power Recharge) change in S.H.I.E.L.D. Solo Mode?
question.locText: Do effects that allow me to draw back up to 3 cards (like Avenger’s Mansion and Iron Man’s Power Recharge) change in S.H.I.E.L.D. Solo Mode?

answer.text: No, you still follow the text exactly, drawing until you have 3 cards in hand.
answer.locText: No, you still follow the text exactly, drawing until you have 3 cards in hand.

question.text: How many cards do I draw when the third Mission is completed?
question.locText: How many cards do I draw when the third Mission is completed?

answer.text: Since you are playing with 3 Heroes, you draw 3 cards.
answer.locText: Since you are playing with 3 Heroes, you draw 3 cards.

question.text: The Stark Labs Location effect says “You may swap 1 card from your hand with 1 of your cards in the Storyline”. Can I use this if my hand has no cards belonging to the active Hero?
question.locText: The Stark Labs Location effect says “You may swap 1 card from your hand with 1 of your cards in the Storyline”. Can I use this if my hand has no cards belonging to the active Hero?

answer.text: In S.H.I.E.L.D. Solo Mode, “you” generally refers to the active Hero. However, in regards to your hand of cards and pool of Action tokens, it refers to the player. So, in this case, you can swap any card from your hand with a card in the Storyline belonging to the active Hero.
answer.locText: In S.H.I.E.L.D. Solo Mode, “you” generally refers to the active Hero. However, in regards to your hand of cards and pool of Action tokens, it refers to the player. So, in this case, you can swap any card from your hand with a card in the Storyline belonging to the active Hero.

question.text: What happens if I play a Hero’s card that says “You cannot take any damage until your next turn”?
question.locText: What happens if I play a Hero’s card that says “You cannot take any damage until your next turn”?

answer.text: The “you” in question refers to that specific Hero, so that Hero keeps the Invulnerable token (and can’t take any damage) until you play another of their cards. (Note that if other Heroes take damage, you may discard cards from the invulnerable Hero, since the hand of cards is collective).
answer.locText: The “you” in question refers to that specific Hero, so that Hero keeps the Invulnerable token (and can’t take any damage) until you play another of their cards. (Note that if other Heroes take damage, you may discard cards from the invulnerable Hero, since the hand of cards is collective).

question.text: HULK - The Hulk Smash! card says it deals 1 damage to EVERYTHING else in his Location. What does that mean exactly?
question.locText: HULK - The Hulk Smash! card says it deals 1 damage to EVERYTHING else in his Location. What does that mean exactly?

answer.text: Deal 1 damage to each Hero (except Hulk), each Thug, each Henchman, and each Villain (if 2 Missions have been completed) in the Location. Note that any Civilians there are discarded, not rescued.
answer.locText: Deal 1 damage to each Hero (except Hulk), each Thug, each Henchman, and each Villain (if 2 Missions have been completed) in the Location. Note that any Civilians there are discarded, not rescued.

question.text: TASKMASTER – If I must add 1 Civilian and 1 Thug token to a Location, but there are no slots available, do I add 2 Crisis tokens to that Location?
question.locText: TASKMASTER – If I must add 1 Civilian and 1 Thug token to a Location, but there are no slots available, do I add 2 Crisis tokens to that Location?

answer.text: No. No matter how many tokens can’t be added, you only add 1 Crisis token to each Location where Overflow was triggered.
answer.locText: No. No matter how many tokens can’t be added, you only add 1 Crisis token to each Location where Overflow was triggered.

question.text: RED SKULL – When the [BAM!] effect is triggered on the Madame Hydra/Crossbones Threat card, must each Hero take 1/2 Crisis tokens to prevent the damage to them, or can a single Hero prevent the damage to all Heroes in that Location?
question.locText: RED SKULL – When the [BAM!] effect is triggered on the Madame Hydra/Crossbones Threat card, must each Hero take 1/2 Crisis tokens to prevent the damage to them, or can a single Hero prevent the damage to all Heroes in that Location?

answer.text: If any Hero (in any Location) takes 1/2 Crisis tokens, that whole [BAM!] effect is cancelled for all Heroes.
answer.locText: If any Hero (in any Location) takes 1/2 Crisis tokens, that whole [BAM!] effect is cancelled for all Heroes.

question.text: RED SKULL – Does the Hail Hydra! Master Plan card have any effect on Locations without Heroes or without Civilians?
question.locText: RED SKULL – Does the Hail Hydra! Master Plan card have any effect on Locations without Heroes or without Civilians?

answer.text: No, it only affects Locations that have both Heroes and Civilians. Heroes in those Locations each take 1 damage. Civilians in those Locations are discarded, advancing the Fear track for each one.
answer.locText: No, it only affects Locations that have both Heroes and Civilians. Heroes in those Locations each take 1 damage. Civilians in those Locations are discarded, advancing the Fear track for each one.

question.text: RED SKULL – Does his [BAM!] effect only increase the Fear track if Heroes are damaged?
question.locText: RED SKULL – Does his [BAM!] effect only increase the Fear track if Heroes are damaged?

answer.text: No. Even if there are no Heroes in his Location, his [BAM!] always increases the Fear track by 2.
answer.locText: No. Even if there are no Heroes in his Location, his [BAM!] always increases the Fear track by 2.

question.text: Can Infinity Stone cards be manipulated in any way by the Heroes?
question.locText: Can Infinity Stone cards be manipulated in any way by the Heroes?

answer.text: During the Battle Against Thanos, Infinity Stone cards are treated just like any other Master Plan card. However, during the Infinity Battles that precede it, Infinity Stone cards are basically just progress markers, and as such cannot be revealed, removed, or rearranged by Heroes.
answer.locText: During the Battle Against Thanos, Infinity Stone cards are treated just like any other Master Plan card. However, during the Infinity Battles that precede it, Infinity Stone cards are basically just progress markers, and as such cannot be revealed, removed, or rearranged by Heroes.

question.text: How does the Battle Against Thanos work in S.H.I.E.L.D. Solo Mode?
question.locText: How does the Battle Against Thanos work in S.H.I.E.L.D. Solo Mode?

answer.text: Like any game in Solo Mode, if you are ever KO’d, you lose the game (and the campaign). Optionally, if you want to make the Infinity Gauntlet campaign more forgiving, you may decide beforehand the number of KOs required before the game is lost. When KO’d, lay down all your Heroes (they are not elliminated). At the start of your next turn, all Heroes are placed back up and, during the Draw Card step, you draw up to 6 cards from the deck.
answer.locText: Like any game in Solo Mode, if you are ever KO’d, you lose the game (and the campaign). Optionally, if you want to make the Infinity Gauntlet campaign more forgiving, you may decide beforehand the number of KOs required before the game is lost. When KO’d, lay down all your Heroes (they are not elliminated). At the start of your next turn, all Heroes are placed back up and, during the Draw Card step, you draw up to 6 cards from the deck.

question.text: DRAX - When playing Revenge, does Drax need to stop at the Villain’s Location even if the Villain can’t be damaged yet?
question.locText: DRAX - When playing Revenge, does Drax need to stop at the Villain’s Location even if the Villain can’t be damaged yet?

answer.text: No, he ignores enemies that can’t be damaged, going to the first Location with any Thugs or a Henchman.
answer.locText: No, he ignores enemies that can’t be damaged, going to the first Location with any Thugs or a Henchman.

question.text: MANTIS - Does Astral Projection allow actions to be performed in only 1 different Location?
question.locText: MANTIS - Does Astral Projection allow actions to be performed in only 1 different Location?

answer.text: No, you can choose a different Location for EACH action you perform that turn.
answer.locText: No, you can choose a different Location for EACH action you perform that turn.

question.text: PUNISHER - Can Precision Shot deal damage to the Villain before 2 Missions are completed?
question.locText: PUNISHER - Can Precision Shot deal damage to the Villain before 2 Missions are completed?

answer.text: No, Villains can only take damage once 2 Missions are completed. Precision Shot bypasses other effects that prevent enemies from taking damage, or that reduce that damage.
answer.locText: No, Villains can only take damage once 2 Missions are completed. Precision Shot bypasses other effects that prevent enemies from taking damage, or that reduce that damage.

question.text: PUNISHER - Does Heavy Firepower also target the Locations adjacent to Punisher?
question.locText: PUNISHER - Does Heavy Firepower also target the Locations adjacent to Punisher?

answer.text: No, it also targets the Locations adjacent to the chosen primary target Location.
answer.locText: No, it also targets the Locations adjacent to the chosen primary target Location.

question.text: SPIDER-MAN 2099 - Can Claws deal damage to an enemy who can’t be damaged, like Taskmaster or Hela?
question.locText: SPIDER-MAN 2099 - Can Claws deal damage to an enemy who can’t be damaged, like Taskmaster or Hela?

answer.text: No, Claws only bypasses effects that reduce damage, like “enemy ignores the first damage each turn”, but the enemy must be vulnerable to damage.
answer.locText: No, Claws only bypasses effects that reduce damage, like “enemy ignores the first damage each turn”, but the enemy must be vulnerable to damage.

question.text: BARON ZEMO - What happens to the Crisis tokens on a Hero card in the Storyline if it goes back to the player’s hand or is flipped facedown?
question.locText: BARON ZEMO - What happens to the Crisis tokens on a Hero card in the Storyline if it goes back to the player’s hand or is flipped facedown?

answer.text: The Crisis tokens are discarded. However, if the card is just moved around the Storyline, they stay on it.
answer.locText: The Crisis tokens are discarded. However, if the card is just moved around the Storyline, they stay on it.

question.text: CARNAGE - If there’s an Overflow, do I discard Civilians with a Crisis token from the Location with the most Civilians, even if other Locations have more Crisis tokens?
question.locText: CARNAGE - If there’s an Overflow, do I discard Civilians with a Crisis token from the Location with the most Civilians, even if other Locations have more Crisis tokens?

answer.text: Yes. It may even be the case that the Location with the most Civilians has no Crisis tokens at all, in which case nothing happens.
answer.locText: Yes. It may even be the case that the Location with the most Civilians has no Crisis tokens at all, in which case nothing happens.

question.text: DOCTOR OCTOPUS - What happens to Threat cards, Thug tokens, and Civilian tokens in Locations that get destroyed?
question.locText: DOCTOR OCTOPUS - What happens to Threat cards, Thug tokens, and Civilian tokens in Locations that get destroyed?

answer.text: They are all discarded. Yes, this could make some Missions impossible to complete if you don’t act quickly.
answer.locText: They are all discarded. Yes, this could make some Missions impossible to complete if you don’t act quickly.

question.text: GREEN GOBLIN - If a [BAM!] makes Green Goblin add a Threat card with a [BAM!] effect on it, is that Threat card’s [BAM!] also activated immediately?
question.locText: GREEN GOBLIN - If a [BAM!] makes Green Goblin add a Threat card with a [BAM!] effect on it, is that Threat card’s [BAM!] also activated immediately?

answer.text: No. While [BAM!]s are resolved one by one, that Threat card wasn’t in play when the [BAM!] was triggered, so its [BAM!] is not resolved.
answer.locText: No. While [BAM!]s are resolved one by one, that Threat card wasn’t in play when the [BAM!] was triggered, so its [BAM!] is not resolved.

question.text: HELA - Where does Hela enter play when resolving her first [BAM!] effect?
question.locText: HELA - Where does Hela enter play when resolving her first [BAM!] effect?

answer.text: All of her [BAM!] cards indicate she must first Move to the Location with the Hero with the most cards in hand.
answer.locText: All of her [BAM!] cards indicate she must first Move to the Location with the Hero with the most cards in hand.

question.text: KANG - If both “Time Army” Threats are in play, do Heroes ending their turn in a Location with any Thugs take 1 or 2 damage?
question.locText: KANG - If both “Time Army” Threats are in play, do Heroes ending their turn in a Location with any Thugs take 1 or 2 damage?

answer.text: 1 damage, as long as at least one of these two Threats is in play.
answer.locText: 1 damage, as long as at least one of these two Threats is in play.

question.text: KILLMONGER - If I use a Location Effect at the end of my turn to move into a Location with an Assassination Attempt Threat, do I take damage that turn?
question.locText: KILLMONGER - If I use a Location Effect at the end of my turn to move into a Location with an Assassination Attempt Threat, do I take damage that turn?

answer.text: No, Location Effects are the last thing resolved in a Hero’s turn, so that Threat would not still take effect.
answer.locText: No, Location Effects are the last thing resolved in a Hero’s turn, so that Threat would not still take effect.

question.text: M.O.D.O.K. - How can Heroes do anything if the Psionic Powers Threat card is in their starting Location?
question.locText: M.O.D.O.K. - How can Heroes do anything if the Psionic Powers Threat card is in their starting Location?

answer.text: Indeed that Threat card can never be in the Heroes starting Location. If Psionic Powers is in the Heroes starting Location, swap it with the next Threat clockwise.
answer.locText: Indeed that Threat card can never be in the Heroes starting Location. If Psionic Powers is in the Heroes starting Location, swap it with the next Threat clockwise.

question.text: RHINO - The Master Plan card ‘Rhino Charge’ says Rhino moves clockwise to the next Location with any Heroes. What happens if all Heroes are in Rhino’s Location?
question.locText: RHINO - The Master Plan card ‘Rhino Charge’ says Rhino moves clockwise to the next Location with any Heroes. What happens if all Heroes are in Rhino’s Location?

answer.text: Rhino moves to the next clockwise Location, and keeps moving over all 6 Locations, until finally charging at the Heroes in his initial Location.
answer.locText: Rhino moves to the next clockwise Location, and keeps moving over all 6 Locations, until finally charging at the Heroes in his initial Location.

question.text: RHINO - If Rhino’s [BAM!] effect KO’s a Hero, is that Hero still moved to the next clockwise Location?
question.locText: RHINO - If Rhino’s [BAM!] effect KO’s a Hero, is that Hero still moved to the next clockwise Location?

answer.text: Yes. Since the Hero was damaged by Rhino’s [BAM!], they are moved to the next clockwise Location.
answer.locText: Yes. Since the Hero was damaged by Rhino’s [BAM!], they are moved to the next clockwise Location.

question.text: RHINO - There are cases where Rhino might start the game by forcing all Heroes to play their card facedown. How can this be avoided?
question.locText: RHINO - There are cases where Rhino might start the game by forcing all Heroes to play their card facedown. How can this be avoided?

answer.text: If players want a less punitive play against Rhino, we recommend placing his 0 Move card on top of his Master Plan deck during Setup.
answer.locText: If players want a less punitive play against Rhino, we recommend placing his 0 Move card on top of his Master Plan deck during Setup.
